intro: Polysphaeria lanceolata subsp. comorensis, commonly known as the Comorian sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Comoros archipelago. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
